data.title: Good PSN games? (PS3)
data.meta_description: Please gimme someI got my old PS3 up and running again recently. They kept the store open but I dunno how long theyâ€™re going to keep it open.(also I d
data.text:
There's a good collection of the classic Doom games, including Final Doom and The Master Levels, called Doom Classic Complete.

I also love the Soldner-X games, Amiga style euroshmups. Very German and very fun.

Team 17 also put out a great collection of classic Alien Breed games on the PS3 and Vita, it's just called Alien Breed (there was a reboot in the late 2000s called Alien Breed Impact/Assault/Descent, which are also on PS3. Not as good but decent too, those three are also part of a collection called Alien Breed Trilogy on PSN).

Datura if you want some weird experimental Demoscene stuff, and Thexder Neo if you want a remake of a pretty unique late 80s mech platformer where you can transform into a plane.

Not sure what you have in your collection so im going to name some big games as well:

The infamous games and DLC where good.

the Uncharted games

The Last Of Us

Super Stardust HD

I think you can still buy Demons Souls on PSN, but the online is turned off now

The Sly collection i believe is till stuck on the PS3 so you might as well

The Ratchet & Clank and Jak and Daxter collections are worth looking into

Ico and Shadow of the colossus collection

Metal Gear Solid 4 and the HD collection if your into those games, and also stuck on ps3

Motorstorm games are worth looking into

Killzone 2 and 3 where ok. But shooters being shooters i don't know if they still hold up.

People dig Tokyo Jungle, which i haven't personally played but is also stuck on ps3 and is usually recommended

puppeteer is another game i haven't personally played yet but people talk about

and there are a good bit of ps1 and ps2 games on there, but i don't think there is anything special about them so you might not want to spend your money on the PSN versions.

Im sure there are alot more but that's what i got off the top of my head. I would also recommend using a site like this to browse the store and find what you want first, because the last time i used the PSN store on ps3 it was basically broken. So find stuff on google and such, then just search the store.

@blergh: Hey, I just played through both the echochrome games recently, they are a lot of fun. I totally forgot the sequel was PS Move required. But luckily I had that set up already because I boot up some of the light-gun games on PS3 here and there. (of which it actually has a pretty solid library!).

My obscure PS3 download recommendation is Mamorukun Curse! , I don't think it came out on any other platforms in the West. It's only 5 bucks, and a fun shoot-em-up in the vein of something like Pocky & Rocky . It's a G. Rev game, so you know it's legit!

A couple standouts on my ps3:

-Renegade Ops

-Tokyo jungle

-Resident evil code veronica x (HD?) is still the most high res version available if im not mistaken. And has some dynamic lights added and stuff. Its not like the one on ps4.

-The last guy

-Dark mist

-Battlefield 1943 is still online and active on ps3!

-Far cry 3 blood dragon

-Both bionic commando rearmed games. The first is the best but second one is fun too if it isnt too expensive.

-Shank 1+2

-Outland

-Hard corps: uprising

-Tales from space: about a blob & blobs attack

-Stacking

-Shatter

-Virtual-On hd (Japan psn store)

-Raystorm hd (Japan psn store)

But it might be worth being aware of "the c-bomb" of the ps3 if you're planning to still purchase games for it online. if anyone doesnt know what it is: Hikikomori media on youtube has a couple great videos on the subject.

And saw someone mentioning demon souls not being able to be played online anymore...thats not entirely true. You only have to input a specific dns adress in your ps3 network setting and you can still play online through a fanmade server.

Same goes for a bunch of different games, last I checked there was a "beta" to get warhawk up and running again in that way as well. Warhawk was so good. Some of the best multiplayer fun ive had.
